comments.commentBody:
Middle class people have no idea how difficult it is to apply for and get benefits.
I know because even though I had a brilliant education: a Phi Beta Kappa key and thirty credits past my M.Ed. I got very sick and had to apply for benefits.
I couldn't believe how difficult the paperwork was and how easy it is to lose a benefit. I'm reapplying for one now because I failed to send in some forms I never got. I'll be out a big chunk of my income (I'm at the national poverty level) until it's corrected.
I also had to take on my health insurance carrier this year when they dropped two important meds. I felt like a general going into battle; I spent ten weeks exploring every venue. I did finally get the meds but by now I know what resources there are to help.

My Haitian home health aide, after listening to me on the phone nonstop,who is a citizen and has been in this country forty years said she wouldn't have the language skills.

I can't imagine someone with no resources or education getting benefits even if they are available. This is harder than the job I had teaching children with severe learning problems.

I am amazed at how many people on the right still cling to the notion that one can get generous cash assistance, free public housing, food assistance and medical care with no effort and thereby match the living standards of middle class Americans. I find this resentment  voiced in sentiments on social media and in private discourse. People really believe that you can have a decent standard of life by what they perceive as cheating the system. Life is hard, hard, hard for those forced by whatever circumstance to subsist on public assistance. Those complaining about so-called welfare cheats really have no idea what life is like for those on public assistance.

Narcissists may indeed "decompensate", or fall apart emotionally, when their facades of superiority are destroyed; sometimes that's violent, in fact.  It would be a shame if the president of the United States did that.  When I start to feel sorry for Trump, and I do, I think of those he would harm--willfully harm--and the danger of his followers and the GOP having power in our nation, and I get over it.

Its strange, but in a weird way I feel sorry for Trump, because he must know he is hated by a large segment of the population.  Most theorists believe that Narcissistic personalities have fragile personality cores that are bolstered by the false, grandiose self.  While he love the attention:   “I feel like a supermodel, but like times 10.” Underneath that bombast and showmanship is a very fragile sense of self.  Once the "mirroring" attention that he craves fades, I predict his core sense of self will implode, and he will experience a precipitous fall.

Putin and Trump perfect together...or in Putin's case the ends justify the means.

The Russians wear their inferiority complex on the outside....Putin is the personification of that....

The modern Olympics is simply a proxy war between nations, fueled by nationalism and funding by multi-national corporations whose own loyalties are solely to their bottom lines. It is no wonder that the IOC operates in much the same manner as FIFA in the awarding of sites, the behavior of both athletes and spectators, the funding of venues, etc.

Sadly, world-wide, ordinary people are happy to watch a rigged contest, be it the Olympics, World Cup, or their nations' politics. Bread and circuses all.

"benevolence from the west..." WHAT?
The breakup if the Soviet Union continued apace regardless of what Russia itself did. Each country chose its own path. And there was money to be made by all the parties involved he internal corruption that was part and parcel to the Soviet sphere manifested itself time and again as the apparatchiks and their clients I n the government turned to the methods of organized crime to steal the wealth of the country. Putin comes from this tradition. Why show kindness to the kleptocrats who have become even wealthier under Putin?
entirely possible.

What would this help?  Putin is a kgb version of Trump.  Russians elect him.  I assume that the Vladster will  assert his dominance by running around not merely stripped to the waist but butt-naked.  The world does not owe Russia any understanding.

Wish you would explain exactly why Trump is considered a racist? People opposed to him keep saying this...and of course he's crude...but I"ve only heard talk about keeping Muslims temporarily out and stopping illegal Mexicans. Is there a Mexican race? No really what actually has he said that's racist? Not a Trump voter (not a Hilary either) just curious.

Ryan's positions seems to be 'Sure, he's a bigot and racist, but he's not a Democrat'. At some point, one can hope, concern for country (used to be called 'statesmanship') will, pardon the expression, trump political expediency. Or will it? The Republicans have certainly shown they are willing to ignore Constitutional duties, impede the ordinary functioning of government, and obstruct and ensnare any legislative process in the name of political expediency. Nominating and running an unqualified, racist, bigoted narcissist as the candidate for president is a small step, hardly much further at all.
You have say that. It's called diplomacy. Bush 43 did that too - famously.

No one is forcing the US athletes to go to Rio. And the Zika threat is way overstated. So stop being an alarmist.

And if you think that eliminating the IOC's or the "hypocrasy", will bring back the "sprit of the games" (whatever that means), think again. Sport is a business; has been since the time of the Greeks, and will always be.
The other Russian sports teams just haven't been caught (yet).

Please explain how that was the "Golden Age", when cheating, doping, and other funny business was rampant? Who says the US didn't dope then?

I guess you have been watching Rocky IV far too many times....

Many of the comments to this article -- to the effect of "why single out the poor Russians, everyone does it" are ignorant.  The Russians are one of the few countries where a pervasive STATE-RUN  system of doping has been in place for decades.  This doesn't mean that doping can't or doesn't happen elsewhere, but it does mean that it has been proven that the Russians are, by far, the most accomplished practitioners of doping. The Russians are too often liars and cheaters in international sports, good riddance to them.

Regarding Hillary doing anything to achieve significant stimulus?

Without 60 *progressive* Dem senators, and majority progressive Dem house members? No way. And I mean *progressive* senators - not the Republicans that the DNC have relabeled as Democrats, and who Obama supports in primaries against true economic progressives.

Fact is, Trump is more likely to actually *want* a robust economy, and is likely to be more effective at getting stimulus, with his willingness to go against the establishment, and Republican congressional leaders having little choice but to go along - or face defeat.

OTOH, If the ex bankers Hillary appoints to key positions say that too much stimulus is bad - do you really think Hillary will disbelieve them? I am not calling her corrupt. I think it is actually worse than that. My assessment is that Hillary genuinely believes as Obama does - that these bankers have the best solutions for everyone, and that if we go against their wishes, it would be a huge mistake. That actually portends worse, because the people she respects are ideologues.

Ideologues will double down on failed elite policies, even as these policies further destroy the world economy, and give us right wing extremists - eventually worse than Trump.

At least Trump is a pragmatist. He is more likely to do both the right and wrong things, and see what works, then do more of that - that is actual pragmatism.

No, a community college student most likely could quote chapter and verse about serious financial struggles. It's good to take a person from an elite college who may not have had any kind of exposure to extreme financial insolvency.

It maybe should be a require college course.

Hi Janice,

I have to agree with the previous poster. Underprivileged Americans already know what's it's like to start life with less. It would be a wonderful thing for all high school graduates, particularly those from affluent backgrounds who have a greater chance of being represented by the federal government that their parents love to demonize, to visit other countries and live among those that will never ever have the opportunities that affluent people have. It's easy to see extreme poverty from a distance and look away. My life has been changed forever by living from day to day constantly seeing people live in extreme poverty. That the United States has so many children living in extreme poverty speaks volumes about the character it's citizens.
I would have been much more impressed if you had chosen a student from an affordable Community College.

She is not a Democrat in reality. She is gathering Republicans around her, as she did at State. She wanted very much to expand wars and start new ones. She strongly supported some very nasty coups and regime change ideas. She promoted hard core Bush era neocons like Victoria Nuland and gave them key opportunities to cause trouble for us. She has said she wants more in Syria for example, outright confrontation with Russia.

What she says on economics is what Republicans say. And trade agreements.

There is one voice of dissent, and it is the very uncertain trumpet of Trump.

Hillary is a serious problem, and Trump exists as a live option because of her as much as the clowns of the Republican Clown Bus.

Democrats could still say no. Even if they don't, it is important to speak up before she starts in opposition to the wars, the neocon adventures, and the neo-liberal Wall Street Washington Consensus economics.

How did the famous speech go?

I have a dream that there will be a day when we will be judged by our actions and not by the color of our skin. (?)

I would interpret that to mean that MLK wanted people to be judged for their actions and not by the color of their skin.
That's because I think everyone can agree that "All men are created equal," while theoretically including women (like "All people are created equal" would tend to imply) is oddly gender-specific.
Many examples in Linda Martín Alcoff's new book:  The Future of Whiteness.

What made me feel threatened? It's neo Maoists like you and Bell who want to change the way I and all whites think. You want everyone to think like you or else they risk being branded a racist.  This is group think Orwellian Maoist fascism and it scares the heck out of me. This is not a free society. I'm just an old school free speech lefty.

who is to say that one should fall in love with a person of a certain race? As an African-American I married a man who was constantly accused of not wanting to be black -- because he married me a very light-skinned black woman. Oh please -- loving someone of a different ethnicity - (race is a human construct and means nothing) just means that yes, love is blind - that's good.  Why don't you consider a white person who marries a black person 'racist' against his/her race? That blacks should marry only blacks --- is a phrase often heard from white racists. What does that make you?

So blacks should marry only blacks? A black marrying a white person is denying his/her ethnicity but a white person marrying a black person is ..not? My first husband was black - a college sweetheart who received insults and claims of self-loathing because he married me - a light-skinned black woman. Since high school and the black is beautiful movement I was made to feel self-conscious of my skin-color (thank you certain girls from Oakland, CA). I live in rural America now am married to a white person and consider myself an African-American educator most concerned with the advancement of our collective.  Consider the fact that we do more damage by proscribing human nature to live our lives in line with some arcane and racist litmus test.

I was an eczema sufferer for my whole childhood and eventually it got so bad I fantasize about amputation of my feet where it was at its worst.

I went on a long journey with a nutritionist who put me on an elimination diet plus many supplements but what really changed the game was a series of colonics. I learned that eczema is in fact connected to the gut.

I eat normally now but the eczema did not return.

Many people aren't aware that chamomile, calendula and ragweed are close relatives; someone allergic to ragweed is often allergic to one or both of the others.  Any mucosa-- nasal, gastrointestinal, bronchial, even vaginal--  may react.  As a pathologist, it was interesting to me that the increased incidence of pediatric eosinophilic esophagitis paralleled the promotion and use of 'natural' tea blends for health.
The Helminths secrete anti inflammatory molecules that reach the blood and has systemic effects.
